page.title: 02Visit To Langton Farm
page.content: The Heslop Family have lived at {Langton Farm}since 1939, it consists of 270 acres of land. The{Victorian {farm house}, built around 1860, is colour_washed cream while the farm buildings are white,this is a sign of {Raby Estates}because Langton Farm belongs to Lord Barnard of nearby Raby Castle. The highest contour on the farm is 400 feet and there are rig and furrow fields.There are traces of 3 wells on the farm and the remains of a water pump in the village. Mr.Heslop grows Winter Barley and wheat, peas, which are dried for animal feed ,Turnips,which are fed to the sheep, and potatoes.Mr.Heslop cuts grass for silage to feed to his beast with crushed barley.
